body_html:
Expanding dims for conv2d_transpose works fine for me.
One small gotcha is that your filter variables will need to be expanded on axis 0, not axis 1, since the conv2d uses the filter width, not filter height. So:

new_x = tf.expand_dims(old_x, 1)
new_W = tf.expand_dims(old_W, 0)
deconv = tf.nn.conv2d_transpose(new_x, new_W, strides, output_shape)
deconv = tf.squeeze(deconv, axis=1)
body_text:
Expanding dims for conv2d_transpose works fine for me.
One small gotcha is that your filter variables will need to be expanded on axis 0, not axis 1, since the conv2d uses the filter width, not filter height.  So:
new_x = tf.expand_dims(old_x, 1)
new_W = tf.expand_dims(old_W, 0)
deconv = tf.nn.conv2d_transpose(new_x, new_W, strides, output_shape)
deconv = tf.squeeze(deconv, axis=1)
body:
Expanding dims for conv2d_transpose works fine for me.
One small gotcha is that your filter variables will need to be expanded on axis 0, not axis 1, since the conv2d uses the filter width, not filter height.  So:

new_x = tf.expand_dims(old_x, 1)
new_W = tf.expand_dims(old_W, 0)
deconv = tf.nn.conv2d_transpose(new_x, new_W, strides, output_shape)
deconv = tf.squeeze(deconv, axis=1)
